author: Special Correspondent
text:
Listening to moral stories will enable in improving self-confidence and imagination power of children, said speakers at a storytelling session held at Anna Nagar Colony Panchayat Union Primary School in Vazhappadi near here Monday.

The session was organised in connection with the Storytelling Day, which falls on March 20.

Ponnambalam, medical officer, Upgraded Primary Health Centre, Thumbal village; Shafeera Banu, Headmistress of the school; Anusuya Sivalingam, dentist; Periyar Mannan, coordinator of the Periyar Training Centre, explained the art of storytelling.

They said that stories with good moral boosted the thinking power of youngsters and motivated them to adopt good principles in their life. Students should avoid watching movies and television programmes and instead approach their grandparents and parents for good stories.
title: A day to tell stories
